description: Erection of a single storey rear extension
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.	Reason:  As required  by Section 91 of  the Town  and Country Planning  Act  1990,  as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

Development  shall  be  carried  out  in  accordance  with  the  materials  specified  on  the approved plans and on the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.	Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Off-street direction signs, hoarding and tower cranes require a license. In the event that a tower crane will be used, a traffic management plan for the delivery, erection, dismantling and removal of the crane(s) will also be required. The applicant is advised to contact the Highway Authority if these will be needed, who will also seek any necessary deposits.
Parking suspensions might be needed to allow access for large construction vehicles. The applicant is advised to contact the Highway Authority if these will be needed.

Please provide revised existing and proposed plans and elevations at a recognised scale of 1:50 or 1:100, providing a scale bar, showing the outline of entire floor plan, not just part and all key dimensions for the proposed works.Please note that the submitted drawings do not scale correctly.

Please confirm description of proposed works -Erection of single storey detached outbuilding in rear garden for use as Games Room.  (Please detail what the use will be for this room, ie Study, Gym etc and whether this will be for habitable use).

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise with information provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:The tree has confirmed Honey Fungus and as such the requirement to plant a replacement is in this instance dispensed with due to the remaining presence in the soil following removal.Recommendation:Approve with no condition for replacement planting due to site constraints.
Inspection:Site inspection carried out in person on 16/11/2023.Assessment:Works necessary for health and safety purposes.Recommendation:Approve.
